New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in a single season.
Ohtani also became the first player to hit three home runs and steal two bases in a game.
Key Match Events: Ohtani finished 6-for-6 with 10 RBIs in a 20-4 romp over the Miami Marlins.
Ohtani added another stolen base before hitting his 49th home run, matching Shawn Green's single-season franchise record.
Pre-Game Insights: Ohtani's goal was to make it to the playoffs, which informed his decision to join the Dodgers this year.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers celebrated Ohtani's achievement with a muted toast, reflecting the team's consistent playoff streak.
Ohtani's teammates were in awe of his performance, with some even tearing up due to the emotional moment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers wore T-shirts honoring Ohtani's 50-50 feat, with images of Ohtani at the plate and sliding safely to steal a base.
Ohtani's fourth home run in three games in Miami capped an electric conclusion to his historic chase.
